74T54 130Q54 140 54 180T55 250Q55 421 57 425Q61 437 75 437Q88 437 91 428T95 393V345V270H835Q719 357 692 493Q692 494 692 496T691 499Q691 511 708 511H711Q720 511 723 510T729 506T732 497T735 481T743 456Q765 389 816 336T935 261Q944 258 944 250Q944 244 939 241T915 231T877 212Q836 186 806 152T761 85T740 35T732 4Q730 -6 727 -8T711 -11Q691 -11 691 0Q691 7 696 25Q728 151 835 230H95V155Z"></path></defs></svg></div><h1>Preconditioned Model Building Solver (PMBSolve)</h1>
<p>PMBSolve is an optimization solver for solving unconstrained problems of the form</p>
<span class="math"><div class="MathJax_SVG_Display" role="textbox" aria-readonly="true" style="text-align: center;"><span class="MathJax_SVG" id="MathJax-Element-5-Frame" style="font-size: 100%; display: inline-block;"><svg xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink" viewBox="0 -779.6258773580086 4140.120344409939 1635.4511999188085" style="width: 9.586ex; height: 3.787ex; vertical-align: -2.13ex; margin: 1px 0px;"><g stroke="black" fill="black" stroke-width="0" transform="matrix(1 0 0 -1 0 0)"><g transform="translate(44,0)"><use xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink" xlink:href="#MJMAIN-6D"></use><use xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink" xlink:href="#MJMAIN-69" x="838" y="0"></use><use xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink" xlink:href="#MJMAIN-6E" x="1121" y="0"></use></g><g transform="translate(0,-701)"><use transform="scale(0.7071067811865476)" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink" xlink:href="#MJMATHI-78"></use><use transform="scale(0.7071067811865476)" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink" xlink:href="#MJMAIN-2208" x="577" y="0"></use><g transform="translate(883,0)"><use transform="scale(0.7071067811865476)" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink" xlink:href="#MJAMS-52"></use><use transform="scale(0.5000000000000001)" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink" xlink:href="#MJMATHI-6E" x="1028" y="593"></use></g></g><use xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink" xlink:href="#MJMATHI-66" x="1937" y="0"></use><use xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink" xlink:href="#MJMAIN-28" x="2492" y="0"></use><use xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink" xlink:href="#MJMATHI-78" x="2886" y="0"></use><use xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink" xlink:href="#MJMAIN-29" x="3463" y="0"></use><use xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink" xlink:href="#MJMAIN-2C" x="3857" y="0"></use></g></svg></span></div><script type="math/tex; mode=display" id="MathJax-Element-5">\underset{x \in \mathbb{R}^n}{\min} f(x),
</script></span>
<p>where <span class="math"><span class="MathJax_SVG" id="MathJax-Element-6-Frame" role="textbox" aria-readonly="true" style="font-size: 100%; display: inline-block;"><svg xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink" viewBox="0 -759.9256641651391 4935.910713728972 994.5515415231475" style="width: 11.479ex; height: 2.367ex; vertical-align: -0.592ex; margin: 1px 0px;"><g stroke="black" fill="black" stroke-width="0" transform="matrix(1 0 0 -1 0 0)"><use xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink" xlink:href="#MJMATHI-66"></use><use xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink" xlink:href="#MJMAIN-3A" x="832" y="0"></use><g transform="translate(1393,0)"><use xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink" xlink:href="#MJAMS-52"></use><use transform="scale(0.7071067811865476)" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink" xlink:href="#MJMATHI-6E" x="1028" y="593"></use></g><use xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink" xlink:href="#MJMAIN-21A6" x="2926" y="0"></use><use xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink" xlink:href="#MJAMS-52" x="4208" y="0"></use></g></svg></span><script type="math/tex" id="MathJax-Element-6">f: \mathbb{R}^n \mapsto \mathbb{R}</script></span> is a differentiable function. Below, we have implementations for various programming languages.</p>
<h2>PMBSolve for Octave/MATLAB</h2>
<p>This implementation has been tested on Octave 4.2.1 and MATLAB 2105b. In addition to basic usage on several test functions, we also present a <strong>matrix factorization</strong> example on a movie recommendation data set.</p>
<h2>PMBSolve for Julia</h2>
<p>This implementation has been tested on Julia 0.4.6. We demonstrate <code>pmbsolve</code> method on several test functions.</p>
<h2>PMBSolve for Python</h2>
<p>Coming soon.</p>
<h2>PMBSolve for C</h2>
<p>Coming soon.</p>
<h1>PMBSolve</h1>
<p>An optimization solver for unconstrained differentiable problems</p>
